Intemperance in Study 

     Intemperance in study is a species of intoxication, and those who indulge in it, like the drunkard, wander from safe paths and 
                                                                           82
stumble and fall in the darkness. The Lord would have every student bear in mind that the eye must be kept single to the glory of God. He is not to exhaust and waste his physical and mental powers in seeking to acquire all possible knowledge of the sciences, but is to preserve the freshness and vigor of all his powers to engage in the work which the Lord has appointed him in helping souls to find the path of righteousness.--C.T. 405, 406.
